DataElement.preferredName: Person Surgical Procedure Biopsy Injury Prior Therapeutic Procedure Occurrence Or Surgery Intent Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a patient to participate in a clinical study related to surgical procedures, biopsies, and injuries prior to treatment occurrence, and the anticipation of operative procedures.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Surgical Procedure Biopsy Injury Prior Therapeutic Procedure Occurrence Or Surgery Intent Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis._Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity._Earlier in time or order._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures._An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Biopsy Injury Prior Therapeutic Procedure Occurrence Or Surgery Intent Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.:Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.:Earlier in time or order.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.:An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.
Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.
An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient had major surgica
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgical procedure, open biopsy or significant traumatic injury within 28 days prior to day 1 of therapy or anticipation of need for major surgical procedure during the course of study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had a major surgical procedure, open biopsy, non-healing wound, ulcer or significant traumatic injury within 28 days prior to starting ramucirumab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had a major surgical procedure, open biopsy, or significant traumatic injury within 28 days prior to initiation of therapy, or anticipation of need for major surgical procedure during the course of the study other than that defined by protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had an open biopsy, non-healing wound, ulcer or significant traumatic injury within 28 days prior to starting treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgical procedure or significant traumatic injury within 28 days prior to day 1 of therapy or open biopsy within 7 days prior to day 1 of therapy or anticipation of need for major surgical procedure during the course of study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had a major surgical procedure or significant traumatic injury (as judged by the investigator) within 28 days prior to start of treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient undergo a major surgical procedure or significant traumatic injury within 14 days prior to study enrollment, or anticipation of need for major surgical procedure during the course of the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient undergo a major surgical procedure or significant traumatic injury within 14 days prior to study database registration, or anticipation of need for major surgical procedure during the course of the study?
